Key Match Events: Austin Wells hit a go-ahead three-run homer in the seventh inning
Wells added an RBI double in the eighth
Hunter Renfroe led off the sixth with a homer to give the Royals a 4-3 lead
Gleyber Torres beat out an infield single
Judge singled to left to easily score Torres
Domínguez singled, stole third base, and scored on a throwing error by catcher Salvador Perez
Alex Verdugo hit a two-run homer
Torres hit an RBI single in the eighth
Wells doubled off the left field wall
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Wells' 404-foot drive was his seventh in his last 37 games since July 21 and sixth as New York’s cleanup hitter behind Judge
Wells tied a career high and drove in four runs for the fourth time since making his debut last September
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees scored double-digit runs for the 13th time this season
Perez homered, went 4 for 4 and drove in Kansas City its first three runs
Rodón allowed four runs (three earned) and six hits in six innings
Cousins (2-1) picked off pinch hitter Kyle Isbel in the seventh
Weaver stranded two in the eighth
Hamilton pitched a 1-2-3 ninth in his first appearance since June 16
Others: Yankees placed INF DJ LeMahieu on the 10-day injured list due to a right hip impingement
LeMahieu may miss the rest of the season
INF Jon Berti was activated after missing 90 games with a strained left calf
